title: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
The CC314 website has a fanfiction area that contains some great stories by someone named "KeenEmpire". Not so long ago I found another story by him that I can't remember anything useful about (except that it was a .pdf file lol). Does he have a website or other stories or anything I can go check out? "Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?"
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
"Three hundred fifteen... This person must be the most intelligent being throughout the entire Universe."

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
As far as I know, he has no site. He stops here once in a while. Perhaps he reads more often than he posts, dunno.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
Ah, yes, that is the one I was referring to. I can't speak for that one anymore since I don't remember it, but your others are pretty good and interesting. They read like a one-shot (all the spelling and grammar errors and the rushed nature), is that what you did? cuz if those are one-shots, well, they'd be even more amazing. Somehow I doubt those last two on CC314 are oneshots though, cuz they're pretty long. ^^;
BTW, Mortimer's Mayhem on the CC314 site seems a lot like your style, and your stories seemed to pick up where it left off. Did you write it too?"Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?"
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
"Three hundred fifteen... This person must be the most intelligent being throughout the entire Universe."

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
All the CC314 stuff were "one-shots", as I recall: I was a kid with an overactive imagination, coming up with the endings to those stories only when I was halfway through, although my elder self sometimes thinks I may have compromised the quality of those stories a bit. The one in the thread isn't a one shot, and in fact has been in development for years.

I'm surprised you noticed the connection to Mortimer's Mayhem. It inspired me to write the first story, which was basically a sequel to it (though, aside from that, there were few connections between them). Unfortunately, Adam's site went down shortly after I submitted it to him, and, thinking his story had been lost, I eventually sent it to Flaose on CC314 instead. Ironically, Mayhem reappeared, and if I recall correctly, it had actually been modified slightly to fit my story - totally wrong, I thought, as it had inspired "The Ancient Ending", and not the other way around.[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

1337 + 666 = 2003[hr][/quote][img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/3852/sheepsmall0sf.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
You've piqued my interest in this Adam fellow. Any other available fanfictions he's wrote (Keen ones, of course)?
And I knew those were one-shots! You are a pretty good improviser.

So what's the Future of Earth story about? How big is it right now? And oh yeah, why do u use .pdf now? As I recall, Mortimer died in a fluke accidenct during an attack since that was basically the only way he could ever let himself die...and it took place in the future where he was alive somehow... bah, idk.

Hah! and just today, I finally understand this line from End of Curses: There is only one true anti-paradox field, Necromancer, that actually works. That is: the magical field itself.
Yeah, even though it's a bunch of one-shot nonsense lol. The first time I read your stuff was way long ago, and I could not comprehend things.

I'm a writer too (hobby, not profession lol), in case you're wondering, although I've never put anything on the net. That's why I'm all interested in your stuff.
"Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?"
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
"Three hundred fifteen... This person must be the most intelligent being throughout the entire Universe."

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
I don't know of any other Adam stories. The Future of Earth, in two sentences, is about a future in which Earth has conquered the entire universe in a xenophobic tyranny. The time-travelling Keen must decide what he's going to do about it. Part I and II currently comprise something like 45 pages, and about 2/3rds of the entire story.[quote]Quote:[hr]Just remember that this is the year of the elite devil.

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
Well I just think it's a lot more cumbersome than .rtf or .doc, and I think you need to buy something in order to make .pdf files, even though you can get the viewer for free. Other than that, idk."Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?"
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
"Three hundred fifteen... This person must be the most intelligent being throughout the entire Universe."

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content: PDF is better than .rtf or .doc if you want your stuff to appear the same wherever it's read, because since both .rtf and .doc are Microsoft inventions they only work best under Windows - PDF has been around for decades and the spec is open, so it's much more robust (and there are plenty of free programs that make PDFs - any default Linux distribution can do it, and you can download one of the free programs like PDFCreator to make PDFs under Windows.)

title: Re: Who/Where is KeenEmpire?
content:
I was thinking that too, that .pdf looks the same period, unlike web pages and .rtf and .doc and w/e else. This is certainly a positive aspect for me, someone who's paranoid about my art; I'll check out the free thingy sometime."Out of curiosity, what is that score in the Earth measurement system?"
"...That would be three hundred fifteen."
